response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
if(it.hasNext()){
i = i + 1;
names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}else{
break;
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use an if statement to check if the iterator still has next() values to return. If it doesn't, then you know it's the last iteration and you can break out of the loop.
